displayName.text: Fort Tryon Center for Rehabilitation and Nursing

formattedAddress: 801 W 190th St, New York, NY 10040, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: Fort Tryon Center for Rehabilitation and Nursing
Fort Tryon Center for Rehabilitation and Nursing
Fort Tryon Center for Rehabilitation and Nursing

adrFormatAddress: 801 W 190th St, New York, NY 10040, USA

originalText.text:
Not great. They are SEVERELY understaffed and getting answers takes forever. My husband was in this facility for over a month and they cleaned his room only twice. It’s disgusting. The mattress is bigger than the actual bed, making it slide down all the time.

Food is TERRIBLE. My family and I brought my husband his three meals every single day because of how bad their food is. We heat our food up in the microwaves and for a few days all three of their microwaves were down. How??

The sink in the bathroom in his room was broken the day we got there. We told staff about four times. It was never fixed. Even the elevator floor tiles come off. This place is an actual joke.

Also the fish tanks in the lobby look like they haven’t been cleaned for years. Truly don’t know how those fish are alive.

The PT/OT team are the only saving grace here. There are a few staff on site that are amazing, but that’s it. I would not recommend bringing loved ones here.

UPDATE: I’m updating since the center responded saying I should have talked to someone. When my husband was there I spoke to EVERYONE about these problems. I spoke to the social worker, the front desk, the nursing supervisor on his floor, the Nurse Manager, and the Executive Director Michael Karash. No one helped. Not once.

originalText.text: This place is absolutely the worse! My Mom gets treated so badly here. She had a stroke and came here for physical therapy to be able to move and walk again and she’s been there now 9 months. Til this day she still can’t walk because they don’t give her the proper physical therapy she needs. They leave her in the bed all day and don’t bother to get her into a wheelchair either. Day after day, week after week, month after month she there laying in a bed! That is no way to treat a human being! The food is also terrible. They give her just steamed carrots and peas most of the time. I have made so so many attempts to get this resolved. I have spoken to the physical therapist, I have spoken to the nurse, the nurse supervisor and even the director Joe. I have also spoken to the social worker which does absolutely nothing! She gives you the run around, she doesn’t answer her phone calls and when you continue to try to contact her she gives you attitude, excuse after excuse and talks over you instead of listening. This is no way to treat someone’s family member. Do not take your loved one here. I’m currently in the process of getting my Mom out of here. It’s unfortunate she couldn’t get the proper care she needed.

It’s unfortunate she couldn’t get the proper care she needed.

originalText.text: Extremely understaffed and the few that are working are defensive and have no compassion for their patients. Dietary restrictions are completely ignored with diabetic patients. When my mom asked for them to change her food because as a diabetic she can’t eat rice or sweets, the reply was “that’s all we got! I’ll just throw it out”! The head nurse never returned after telling my mom she would let her know whether or not she would need insulin. My mom called for her and said “you never gave me an answer on whether or not I could eat my food or if I would need insulin”.. her reply was “you need to tell this organization to hire more people, I have to take care of 30 people and can’t come right away”. Completely dismissive, inconsiderate with no desire to try and help. The facility is dated as is the equipment, beds, tv etc. the tv has no remote, the bed doesn’t work. They won’t provide a commode and prefer to put patients in diapers for hours and hours. The level of care here is horrendous. Hire all new staff and renovate everything from the basement to the rooftop

originalText.text: This place is dump. I have my 102yr old grandfather here due to a hip injury which he endured surgery and went well at his age. He is strong, and has all his wits. He was put in a room with 2 other patients. It reeks of urine. I had to tell the custodian to mop it. They gave him a brief therapy one day. He’s been here 4days already. They put a pamper on him. He did his business, called to get changed and left him in His urine& feces for more than 8hrs. He is now afraid to do anything in his pamper for lack of attention. Would they do that to their baby?  The nurses have terrible attitudes. They shouldn’t work in a place like this If they have NO patience. I see a big change in him now. He is very depressed and is going downhill. They don’t even deserve a 1star rating.

originalText.text:
My mother has been here for a few months now. The lack of communication and trying to get a hold of someone is terrible. My mom is bedbound. They have her laying in her poop and urine for hours at a time. My sister had to push for her to get better physical therapy care but now they discharged her from therapy due to her complaining that she was in pain. I live out of state and my other siblings that live in the city are so busy with their jobs that they can't visit as often as they want to keep an eye on the staff and make sure they're doing their job. Today my sister went to visit her and come to find they served my mother just PEAS & CARROTS  for dinner!!! with a cup of coffee. They said since that facility is "Jewish owned" that they don't serve meat and that peas and carrots are considered a meal! WHAT??? I am so livid. They are always making excuses that don't make any sense. My mother said they served her the same thing yesterday. Like seriously??? Would they serve that to their mother as a "meal"? they are taking the insurance money and not giving these patients the proper care they need. The nurses are no help either. (Thats if you can find one) Everytime we try to ask them a question they always say "I don't know".  It's sad that we can't find a decent place in NY to care for our loved ones.
This is not even the half of it. Good luck finding a place for your loved one.
